page.title: 01Edlington.
page.content: Edlington 4 miles SSW of Doncaster is a large colliery village. Yorkshire Main Colliery began production in 1911 and the village has expanded from that time.A large plastics firm further developed industry and there are a number of other light industries in the area. The children of the area can be educated throughout their school-lives within the village,which also caters for multi-denominational worship,has a swimming pool,library,health and adult education services,pubs and clubs. Old Edlington was the original hamlet and lies to the south of the new village at the edge of farming country.Here there is a fine example of Norman architecture;St.Peter's Church. The area also includes the largest deciduous woodland in Yorkshire.
